taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek akamptos , stiff or unbending, and pappus , alluding to thick pappus elements]

place_of_publication.publication_title: Mem. Amer. Acad. Arts, n. s.

bio:treatment.discussion: Acamptopappus is essentially endemic to the Mojave Desert of California, Arizona, Nevada, and Utah. The genus is recognized as low, white-barked, desert shrubs with pedunculate heads, borne singly or in loose, corymbiform arrays, with ovate phyllaries with broad hyaline margins, 0 or 5–14 yellow rays, sericeous to villous cypselae, and thick pappus scales.

references.reference: Lane, M. A. 1988. Generic relationships and taxonomy of Acamptopappus (Compositae: Astereae). Madroño 35: 247–265.

key_statement.description: Heads borne singly; involucres campanulate to hemispheric, 7–10 mm wide; rays 5–14
Heads in loose, corymbiform arrays; involucres hemispheric to globose, 8–16 mm wide; rays 0
